page.title: 03PRINCIPAL FEATURES
page.content: Silkstone originally coal mining village.First written record of coal mined 1607.From 1790 to 1846 coal transported by waggon and horses on old waggonway completed in 1810 loaded onto barges at Cawthorne Basin.Remains of waggonway still to be seen.Other historic features-old Endowed School,rebuilt 1840's,old police house ,village stocks,Pot House Mill,iron furnace at Low Mill worked in 1700's , now being restored.Church of All Saints built on Saxon remains about 1150.Churchyard contains monument dedicated to 26 children aged 7 to 15 who died in local pit disaster 1838.Village now has council and private estates,two public houses, working men's club,health centre, garage/mini market,fish and chip shop ,butchers,general store,garden nursery.
